Row.Text: [ICON_BULLET][b]Audience Chamber[/b]: +3 food (from +0), +1 amenity (from +2), +3 housing (from +4) in all cities with a governor. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Warlord's Throne[/b]: completely replaced with - gives +25% production to naval and land military units, +2 of each unlocked strategic per turn, reduces unit maintenance by -1 gold and increases strategics stockpile by 30 (in normal speed) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Foreign Ministry[/b]: receive +2 influence per turn and 2 envoys [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Grand Master's Chapel[/b]: can buy units with faith, only in the player's founded cities [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Intelligence Agency[/b]: +50% production toward spies

1 Housing removed from Lighthouse and added to Harbor [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Shipyard[/b]: +1 coal once revealed (from +0). Now grants production to Fishery tiles [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Seaport[/b]: +3 great admiral points (from +1)

Civics Tree Changes [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Nationalism inspiration changed to "Own a Level 3 Land Unit" (from Start a war using a Casus Belli) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Craftsmanship inspiration: Improve 2 tiles [from 3] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Foreign Trade inspiration: Own 1 scout [from discover a new continent] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Humanism inspiration: Own 2 amphitheaters [from recruit a Great Artist]

All technologies after the Classical Era cost 5% more science. [NEWLINE] Era Gate for technologies is increased to 30% (from 20% base game). This is a mechanic when you are researching technologies of an era ahead of the current game era whereby the cost of those technologies is increased. [NEWLINE] Tech Tree Changes [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Advanced Ballistics moved to a Modern Era technology, no dependencies changed. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Steam Power now requires Scientific Theory [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Steel eureka changed to "Own a Renaissance Wall" (from Build a Coal Mine and Ironclad) [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Robotics now has Composites and Telecommunications as added tech prerequisites [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Guidance Systems eureka changed to Kill a unit with a Fighter [from kill a Fighter]

[ICON_BULLET][b]Battering Ram / Siege Tower[/b]: Obsolete at Military Science (from Civil Engineering) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Military Engineer[/b] [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] 3 movement (from 2) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] 3 charges (from 2) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Can build roads without using a charge [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Railroads moved to Scientific Theory (from Steam Power) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Tunnels moved to Military Science (from Chemistry) [NEWLINE] [/t][ICON_BULLET] Military Engineers can use a charge to complete 50% of a city's flood barrier production (from 20%) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Medic[/b]: Moved to Military Science (from Sanitation), grants +1 movement to melee, anti-cav, and ranged units (from +0) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Anti-Air Gun[/b]: Unlocked at Steel (from Advanced Ballistics) [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET][b]Mobile SAM[/b]: +125 Anti-air combat strength (from +100). This is enough to defend nuclear missiles. -5 Anti-air combat strength vs all planes (total = +110 from +100). +2 movement (from 2 to 4)

Siege units no longer receive support bonus. [NEWLINE] All siege units get +10 in defense against ranged units. [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] [b]Artillery[/b] and [b]Rocket Artillery[/b]: +5 ranged strength against city centers

[ICON_BULLET] When a spy is captured, you gain +1 spy capacity. This is because in multiplayer, especially team games, there is no way of getting your spy back unlike if it is killed. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] "Neutralize Governor" and "Sabotage Production" mission duration increased to 6 turns [from 4]

[ICON_BULLET] +100% prod towards support units card moved from Communism tech to Ideology [ICON_BULLET] [b]Bastions[/b]: +0 city ranged strength (from +5) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Communications Office[/b]: +2 loyalty per governor promotion (from +1) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Discipline[/b]: Combat bonus against barbarian buffed to +10 (from +5) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Limes[/b]: never gets obsolete, +50% production toward walls (from 100%) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Medina Quarter[/b]: +1 Housing per District (from +2 Housing in cities with 3 specialty districts) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Military First[/b]: Unlocked at Mobilization (from Rapid Deployment) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Praetorium[/b]: +20% production on conquered cities with a governor and +4 loyalty for governors (from +2). [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Rationalism[/b], [b]Grand Opera[/b], [b]Simultaneum[/b] and [b]Free Market[/b]: Require 13 pop (from 15), and adjacency bonus of +3 (from +4) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Retinues[/b] and [b]Force Modernization[/b]: -50% of resource cost to both produce and upgrade units (from upgrade only) [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] All Strategic Resource policy cards now give a base +2 of the resource, in addition to the normal +1 by worked resource. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] All Melee and Ranged unit production policy cards now also include Recon units. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] [u]3 new cards to boost Siege Unit production:[/u] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Siegecraft[/b]: Available at Military Tradition, +50% production towards ancient, classical and medieval era siege units. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Hard-shell Explosives[/b]: Available at Medieval Faires, +50% production towards siege units from renaissance era and before. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Trench Warfare[/b]: Available at Scorched Earth, +50% production towards all siege units [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Colonial Offices[/b]: +15% faster growth, +10% Production and 3 Loyalty per turn for cities 8 tiles away from your capital. [Obsolete at Colonialism] [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Sovereign Trade[/b]: Open borders with all city states (obsolete at Ideology, as Ideology gives open borders with all city states), unlocked at Civil Service. [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Gunboat Diplomacy[/b]: +4 points Influence points per turn toward earning Envoys and +1 Gold from each of your Envoys at city-states. (removed the open borders with city states but merged the card with Merchant Confederation). Merchant Confederation is now obsolete at Ideology [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] [b]Raj[/b]: +1 Prod, Food and +2 Science, Culture, Faith and Gold for Trade Route to city-states. (old bonus removed) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] New military policy card unlocked at Military Training: Grants +10 regeneration per turn for land units outside of friendly territory

[u][b]Science Victory[/b][/u] [NEWLINE] If a spaceport is pillaged, the booster projects in launched do not grant extra light years per turn towards Exoplanet Expedition [NEWLINE] Settings Options for Science Victory: [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Standard - default Firaxis settings, default Legacy BBG setting [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Early - cheaper space projects and lowered cost for future era techs [NEWLINE] [ICON_BULLET] Earliest - even cheaper space projects and even lowered cost for future era techs

[ICON_BULLET] Relic Reward: the possibility of relics are delayed until turn 15 (from start of game) [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Free governor title is now only possible starting turn 25 [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET] Free technology is now only possible starting turn 31
